page.title: 15POSTAL SERVICE
page.content: The Postal service in the district is typical of that to be found in rural communities. Many people live in farmhouses which are some distance from the main highways so that it is common practice for the postman to make his delivery to some central location from which the mail may be collected. The local, village shop often serves this purpose as does the school. In fact, the delivering postman will even collect letters to be posted if they are left fixed in the letter box of the school ready for him. Some of the post boxes also are reminders of times gone by. The collection box in Shirwell Town still bears the insignia 'V.R.' and others in the district display 'G.R'.
